title: How to Make Kashmiri Noon Chai

steps.headline: Take The Noon Chai Tea leaves.
Add the tea leaves into the water and steep it well.
Allow the tea leaves to boil well in the water.
steps.description: This might even take an hour for one to get good tea.

steps.headline: Mix it well and see the change in color of the tea.
Observe the effervescence in the tea.
steps.description: There are many bubbles formed and these begin to emerge as soon as the soda is added to the tea.

steps.headline: Keep stirring continuously with the help of a spoon.
Observe the changes in the color of the tea water and the size of the tea leaves.
steps.description: The consistency of the fluid is also changed at this time.

steps.headline: Add milk into the steeping tea.
Observe the pink tea formation and the manner the color changes.
Pour the tea into the flask.
Serve it with snacks, such as Kashmiri breads, for breakfast, or in the afternoon.

text: Take a  kettle.  Take The Noon Chai Tea leaves.  Add the tea leaves into the water and steep it well.  Allow the tea leaves to boil well in the water. This might even take an hour for one to get good tea. Take some salt.  Add salt to the tea.  Mix it well and see the change in color of the tea.  Take some baking soda.  Add to the tea.  Observe the effervescence in the tea. There are many bubbles formed and these begin to emerge as soon as the soda is added to the tea. Keep stirring continuously with the help of a spoon.  Observe the changes in the color of the tea water and the size of the tea leaves. The consistency of the fluid is also changed at this time. Add milk into the steeping tea.  Observe the pink tea formation and the manner the color changes.  Pour the tea into the flask.  Serve it with snacks, such as Kashmiri breads, for breakfast, or in the afternoon.
